Pros- the house was cute and very easy to find in a decent neighborhood. I was allowed to check in early which was great.
Cons- the stairs to the loft felt unsafe to me as I almost fell down them a couple of times just bringing my bags up there. Couldn’t control the thermostat which then made the upstairs loft super hot even with the fan going up there. I couldn’t sleep in the bed because it was too hot and not safe for me to carry my infant up or down the stairs. There is a door leading to the other side of the duplex in the upstairs loft which made me feel uncomfortable and unsafe as I didn’t know who was next door. The neighbors in the duplex next door was loud after 10pm as late as 1am most of the nights I stayed which kept my infant up and even woke him up after he finally fell asleep. There wasn’t slippers or sandals like I expected. The travel size soaps and stuff like that most were used.
My stay could have been better but you get what you pay for I guess.

I would suggest future guests bring bottled water. There were none in the fridge. The climate control is located in another part of the home. You do not have access to this. I eventually brought my big suitcase back downstairs so everything I needed was on the main floor level so I didn’t have to navigate the steps as often. One more note, I am very sensitive to dare I say “paranormal” entities. So when I saw the upstairs closet with no door or covering over it I freaked out a tad bit. review_text: I was prepared to give this Airbnb a 5-star rating.... it was clean, a good location and the communication was very good! However, about an hour or so before we were going to check out, I saw that I had an email from the host. The email asked that we move one of our cars so that the tenant who was staying in the basement could park their car in a spot. What?!!!! That was a shock to me and my family members who were staying in the house. We had no idea that there was someone else staying in the house with us. When you rent an Airbnb and it is listed as "Entire 3-bedroom home", you expect that you have the entire home, but that was not the case. The fine print stated that someone may be staying in the basement, but when you rent an "Entire 3-bedroom home", it should be expected that you have the entire home and they then will not rent out the basement because that is part of the entire house! So, much to our surprise, there was someone (who?!!!!) staying and sleeping in the basement of the house. Yes, there was a separate entrance, however, the entrance to that basement area was through the main entrance at the back of the house through the porch that both of us entered in. (Maybe they locked the outside door, maybe they didn't!). We could have easily opened the door from the kitchen to the porch and been startled by someone standing there inside the house that was not one of our family members. Or, we could have heard someone enter the house after we had gone to bed and not knowning that they rented the basement and had access to the home and we thought it was an intruder and called police. This person/people may have been the nicest people you could have ever met or they could have been a serial killer. The host knew nothing about me and my family and I'd assume they knew just as much about the other party in the basement. This home is an old home and the floors are very, very creaky! I don't know how they slept while we were up late that night and early that next morning with all those creaky floors and we didn't try to be quiet because we thought we had the entire house as it was advertised! We had 6 adults in the home with one bathroom so there was a lot of movement. AND, I'm sure he/she/they heard all of our conversations as there are many floor grates in the house. If the basement is going to be utilized by some other party, then the Airbnb listing should be "Entire 3-bedroom 1ST FLOOR". I just thought that was very unprofessional and misleading! I wanted to give this home a 5-star rating, but I could not do so after knowing that someone else was in the basement - too creepy! Just thought anyone who rents this Airbnb in the future should know that you are not actually getting the "Entire Home" and are actually only getting the "Entire 1st Floor" and you may have someone you don't know sleeping in the same house with you, entering and exiting the house and you are expected to meet their requests when you rented the "Entire Home"... it was just wrong!
